publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1237# Mark Ballard: Thrive Scotland Exhibition-That the Parliament welcomes the exhibition being held by the national horticultural charity, Thrive Scotland, in the Parliament foyer from 14 June 2004; recognises that Thrive exists to enable disadvantaged, disabled and older people to participate fully in the social and economic life of the community and that it supports a network of specialist projects that run programmes of horticultural activity for training and employment, therapy and health, and commends Thrive Scotland for its commitment to the needs of some of those who are most disadvantaged in the community, particularly people with mental health problems, learning difficulties, ex-offenders, substance abusers, people with physical health difficulties and the very old.
S2M-1237# Thrive Scotland Exhibition (lodged on 30 April 2004) Christine Grahame*, Mike Pringle*
S2M-1237# Thrive Scotland Exhibition (lodged on 30 April 2004) John Swinburne*, Donald Gorrie*

S2M-1237# Thrive Scotland Exhibition (lodged on 30 April 2004) Mr Mark Ruskell*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Shiona Baird*, Patrick Harvie*, Ms Sandra White*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Eleanor Scott*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*
S2M-1237# Thrive Scotland Exhibition (lodged on 30 April 2004) Chris Ballance*
S2M-1237# Thrive Scotland Exhibition (lodged on 30 April 2004) Frances Curran*, Robin Harper*
S2M-1237# Thrive Scotland Exhibition (lodged on 30 April 2004) Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-1237# Thrive Scotland Exhibition (lodged on 30 April 2004) Fergus Ewing*, Trish Godman*, Rosie Kane*
